sentences.en: A soft qualm regret, flowed down his backbone, increasing.
sentences.cn: 淡淡的疑惧,悔恨之情, 顺着他的脊骨往下串.

sentences.en: Despite my qualms, I took the job.
sentences.cn: 尽管有些疑虑，我还是接受了那份工作。

sentences.en: He felt a qualm in his stomach, and it was more in memory of his loneliness.
sentences.cn: 想到了很多以前的孤独生活, 他感到很不安.

sentences.en: He felt the flowing qualm spread over him.
sentences.cn: 他觉得那股疑惧涌遍全身.

sentences.en: Hurstwood suffered a qualm of body as the car rolled up.
sentences.cn: 当电车开上前时,赫斯渥浑身感到一阵不安.

sentences.en: Lastly she arrived at the tresses and felt a qualm of disgust.
sentences.cn: 最后,她看到提到头发的那一句,心里觉得一阵恶心.

sentences.en: The doctor seemed seized with a qualm of faintness.
sentences.cn: 博士显得好象一阵眩晕发作.

sentences.en: The manager has no qualms about dropping players who do not perform well.
sentences.cn: 对于放弃那些表现不好的队员，主教练并无不安。

trans.tran_cn: 不安，疑惧，恶心，眩晕，忧虑，良心谴责
trans.tran_en: a feeling of slight worry or doubt because you are not sure that what you are doing is right
